programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy bids on some vintage items at auctions in Palm Springs, and Darrell and Rene compete against each other.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones find a miniature antique firearm and a collection of unique remote-controlled vehicles at an auction in California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid for a 1970s dune buggy and a vintage pool table at a desert auction in Palm Springs, California.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go head to head in a series of tense locker auctions in Oak Cliff, where they bid for a unit of antique electronics and a strange vaudeville curio.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: You Bought It, You Break It
programme.desc: Fortune seems to favour Moe and Mary when they visit Mesquite, Nevada, the town where Ricky and Bubba experienced their infamous losing streak.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz take their nephew on his first pick and visit the 1890s home that once belonged to an opera singer.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The weather grows colder, driving the alligators to seek shelter - but Trey has a secret weapon to force them out of hiding.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.sub-title: Best Little Boar House in Texas
programme.desc: A feisty freeloader raids the refuse bins at a barbecue joint and 'turtleman' Ernie Brown Jr must catch it before the situation worsens.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Ernie Brown Jr and Team Turtle must remove an alligator from a residential area before it gets too comfortable. Plus, a football team's mascot is stolen before an important game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Members of the team get their hands on a rare photograph of Albert Einstein and a collection of top-secret documents from the Pentagon.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on the rampage when he finds out a thief has been on the premises, and a customer selling a guitar signed by Kid Rock reveals a valuable secret.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout time, people have believed mountains were the home of the divine. This edition investigates whether hilltop spirits, which some through time have believed to inhabit mountains, could have been extraterrestrials.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether aliens lie at the heart of Earth's most famous mysteries. In this instalment, he looks at the new clues narrowing down the possible location of Atlantis, suggesting that Plato's mysterious island was the home of an advanced civilisation.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Poor weather causes trouble for the bargain-hunting bidders as they attend auctions in Mineral Wells.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Waxahachie, where wood expert Moe Prigoff meets his match.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley comes out from behind the security glass to confront a menacing customer, and there is more trouble when a man claims he has been robbed in the shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley is in trouble with Seth and Les, who discover she is to blame for the shop's current cash crisis.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a 1920s doll of aviator Charles Lindbergh and a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: This special episode strolls through the archives of Storage Wars' very own master and apprentice; Darrell and Brandon Sheets. Whether the father and son team is winning big, or busting big, one thing's for sure... for 'The Gambler', profit is just a flip of the coin away..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Once Upon a Locker in the West
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at locker auctions in Santa Ana, where Darrell makes a find that could mean another huge win for the Gambler.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid against inexperienced competitors for a vintage fishing seat at a container auction in San Diego.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid against a wealthy opponent in San Diego, and succeed in securing a 1950s baseball machine and a 1980s hydraulic rescue tool.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A bidding war erupts between the buyers as they attend the latest round of auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor tries to end his losing streak in Waxahachie, but faces some tough competition.

programme.title: Air Crash Special Report
programme.desc: How automated technology in planes is designed to assist pilots rather than replace them.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Experts join the trail of purported Nazi time travel device, Die Glocke, to try and find out if it really did exist and if it could it have been based on alien technology.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate strange carvings from 8,000 BC and unexplained sightings in the New World, which could suggest there is more to the US's past than written in the history books.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth finds himself in the cross hairs after his new employee makes a big mistake, while Ashley is forced to face one of her most insulting customers yet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: As a storm threatens to knock out the shop's power, Seth hatches an emergency plan - only for it to be shot down by his father.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seth's master plan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones set their sights on an undertaker's tool kit, scuba diving equipment and a shark cage at an auction in Oxnard, California.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff attends an auction in Ventura County, California, where he spots a vintage suitcase and other items with potential in a unit full of office furniture.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.sub-title: What is a Picker? And Story of Ireland
programme.desc: Find out what an Irish picker is and learn the history of Ireland through interesting objects..

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Cindy buys a shirt for Rick that is not to his taste, while Bogart puts his dad on an extremely healthy diet - much to his displeasure.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Keep Your Friends Close and the Veterans Closer
programme.desc: Paul and Bogart take aim at auction veterans Cindy and Tim, while Ursula is on the lookout for items that cater to men.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: This special episode of Storage Wars focuses on Jarrod and Brandi, reflecting on their rise from auction buying rookies to thrift store power couple. There will be fights... there will be feuds... and not always with the other buyers..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Mary discovers that lockers can lead to romance at auctions in Riverside. Meanwhile, Dave finds something that leaves him baffled.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Broadcaster Dev Griffin and comedian Susan Calman play a series of video games, including Minecraft, Ark: Survival Evolved, Batman Arkham Asylum and Balloon Chair Death Match VR.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Russell Howard uses ear wax to charm a nice lady called Carol, Asim Chaudhry goes digging for invertebrates and Liza Tarbuck makes a puzzle for children.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Pointless co-host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with comedian Sindhu Vee and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz that tests the most obscure parts of contestants' general knowledge, awarding points for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Bill Bailey, Jimmy Carr and Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell to answer fiendish questions on the topic of jargon.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Thanks to back flips and rail rides, Tim and Gendle are in BMX bike heaven. With the clock ticking it is down to Joe and the build team to construct the ultimate BMX set-up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: A father and son request a cutting-edge carbon fibre body kit for their Lamborghini Aventador S, hoping it will be ready in time for a European road rally.

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni and the team customise an i8 Roadster, a convertible hybrid supercar that owner David Vaughn wants to be wrapped in fluorescent yellow.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank saves a vintage muscle car from meeting a rusty end, while Mike falls for a 100-year-old hotrod. A man cave also presents them with some sweet deals.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori strike it rich, and 'T-Money' takes risks while bidding.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: In one of the most unusual auctions yet, Sean invites people to bid for the contents of abandoned lorries.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team are venturing into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take the them through a forest unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond tests Volkswagen's Touareg off-roader, before driving a racing version of the car against a group of snowmobile riders in Sweden. James May tries to drive faster than he has ever done before in the Bugatti Veyron Super Sport, Jeremy Clarkson examines the legacy of Formula One driver Ayrton Senna, and Tom Cruise and Cameron Diaz are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: More thrills, spills, customer carts and crashes in this extreme downhill battle at the Eduardo VII Park in Lisbon.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond travel to Africa, where they are challenged to buy a second-hand car costing less than Â£1,500 and in no way designed to go off-road, and drive across Botswana. Along the way they must negotiate salt pans, rivers and reserves full of animals while facing sweltering heat and suffocating dust.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters hit the road in a Jensen-Healey, a Lotus and a TVR as they chart the decline of the British sports car industry, on a journey from Norfolk to Blackpool. On the test track, Jeremy Clarkson enthuses about the Ferrari 458 Italia, and actor Jeff Goldblum is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck still leads the pack of five comics, as Russell Howard wraps a tie round his head and Tim Vine is left bereft by a small piece of bent metal.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Jason Manford, chart star Paloma Faith and Dragons' Den entrepreneur Deborah Meaden compete to have their pet hates banished on the panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include people who use the phrase 'all due respect', smart-casual dress, jobsworths, people in lifts and Fifty Shades of Grey.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Singer Cilla Black, Outnumbered star Hugh Dennis and The Great British Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc compete to have their pet hates banished by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include dream bores, giant charity cheques, Las Vegas, knickers and people who make others sign cards.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Crystal Maze host Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with comedian Roisin Conaty and broadcaster Robert Peston joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Chris Kamara asks Jon to take part in a Leeds United fundraiser for deprived children. While he's away Lucy tries to enrol Elsie in a private school - against Jon's wishes.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and asks a range of unusual questions about journeys, finding out how much Rob Brydon, Phill Jupitus, Cal Wilson and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the subject.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, first aired in June and hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, London Hughes, Rhys James and Milton Jones. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: The Allies entered Germany and ran into the imposing Siegfried Line defences. American troops fought to a gruelling, bloody standstill in the Huertgen Forest, at a terrible cost.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.sub-title: Tudor Parfitt & The Lost Tribes of Israel
programme.desc: The claims of British historian, writer, broadcaster and adventurer Professor Tudor Parfitt, who says he located an African tribe of Jews called the Lemba whose roots can be traced back to the Jews of the Old Testament.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates a horrifying discovery made in a Brighton left luggage office in 1934 - which was soon followed by a similar suspicious incident in London.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When Churchill Chose War
programme.desc: Pivotal moments in history recreated using archive materials and dramatic reconstructions, beginning with Churchill persuading the British government to go to war.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: The Allies entered Germany and ran into the imposing Siegfried Line defences. American troops fought to a gruelling, bloody standstill in the Huertgen Forest, at a terrible cost.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Divers explore the wreck of First World War battleship HMS Audacious, which was once the pride of the Royal Navy and thought to be 'unsinkable' until a single unexpected blow sealed its fate 14 miles off the coast of Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: The Day When
programme.sub-title: The Day When De Gaulle Chose War
programme.desc: Charles De Gaulle's refusal to surrender to the German invasion of France in 1940, and his subsequent escape to London and establishment of a French government in exile.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Hitler's launch of his great counter-offensive against the unsuspecting Allies in the Ardennes. This was the Nazis' last gamble in the West to turn the tide of the war.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80's, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Aircraft restoration expert Mark Masters and his son James rebuild a 1943 US Army Aeronca Defender liaison plane for its German owner.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: In the first round, Gordon Ramsay tests the contestants' knife skills, challenging them to finely slice fresh herbs including basil and chives, before they are tasked to joint two whole chickens in 10 minutes. Finally, the third round sees the remaining cooks select an array of fruit, vegetables and other ingredients from the larder to create a dish using the chicken they prepared in the previous challenge.

programme.title: Scotland Revealed Moments
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge presents aerial views of the Borders, observing stately homes, vast meadows and rolling hills.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: The Inbetweeners and I'm a Celebrity star Emily Atack talks about teaming up with Susanna for Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, her brand new show and her mum's famous cousin, Paul McCartney.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five contestants from Yorkshire answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Simon, Duncan, Michelle and Annabel pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie deals with consequences, Dan comes into serious danger, and Liam is forced to make a choice.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Brenda is nervous, Paddy feels anxious, and Dawn plays happy families with Lucas.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The funeral industry is worth more than two billion pounds, but are people paying too much for funerals? Sonali Shah investigates.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: The rail mobile detection team discovers a high-tech home - complete with electricity, running water and TV - illegally erected under an arch beside one of the country's busiest areas of track. At Euston, Transport Police officers are called upon when tempers flare - and deal with an unusual Royal request. Meanwhile, a strike hits Birmingham's New Street Station and the rail network on one of the busiest days of the year. With industrial action on West Midlands Trains, many passengers are left high and dry, and it's down to Network Rail to deliver the bad news.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Spirit of Queensland: Brisbane to Cairns 'Don't Let it Kill You'
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones journeys from Brisbane to Cairns aboard the Spirit of Queensland railway - and during his various stops, he comes across all manner of things that seem determined to kill him, from jellyfish to dingoes to whitewater rapids and more.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: As the investigation takes a shocking turn, secrets rise to the surface. When Andrew was living in Edinburgh, a strange turn of events brought him face to face with an old acquaintance, whose deeply corrosive influence becomes clear. Meanwhile, the tragic recent history of Laura's family helps explain the deep bond she and Katy share, as well as the lengths Laura will go to for those she loves. Will her past catch up with her, just as Andrew's did? Thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they turn trees into billions of pencils? How do they make liquorice? And, how do they use traditional techniques to weave the world's most fashionable lace?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer set the challenge to find the ultimate bug-out vehicle that would ceaselessly run, and decide on the Land Rover Series IIA.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In South Australia, rookie miners Daniel Becker and Justin Lang leave their lives behind, risking all to chase an opal fortune.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Teutul Sr asks his son Paul Jr to look after the shop while he is away promoting his book, in a bid to keep the Mountain Creek project running smoothly.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Rudi wants the team to get his 1964 Dodge Dart on target. Plus, Gordon needs an automatic transmission in his beloved 1965 Shelby Cobra kit car.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits a dairy farm in Ramona, CA where he learns how to milk and breed dromedary camels.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as the series reveals how rawhide lampshades and MRI scanners are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as the series reveals how noise barrier walls, Bourbon, and front-load washers are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production processes of non-alcoholic beers, heavy-duty cars able to negotiate rocks and boulders, escalators and lie detectors.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain to find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners, turning items into hard cash. A butter churn, a slot machine and a set of print trays are among the finds in this edition.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: A Slap in the Face or a Kick in the Butt
programme.desc: Midway through the season, the crews begin to find their work hampered by the intense cold, as the crabs, equipment and harbour all freeze. Meanwhile, the Northwestern battles a raging storm.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: With temperatures rising and the Bering Sea melting, time is running out for the fleet of gold dredgers, and one team sees their dream float away as the ice fractures.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In South Australia, rookie miners Daniel Becker and Justin Lang leave their lives behind, risking all to chase an opal fortune.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Edd China completes the BMW 635CSi renovation project, Mike Brewer values the vehicle and goes looking for a potential buyer.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells classic Italian sports cars, including a 1971 Ferrari Daytona Spyder, at an auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.sub-title: Amelia Island: Get Some, Give Some
programme.desc: Wayne Carini auctions off a 1949 Mercury Woodie wagon and a rare 1961 Austin-Healey 3000 Mk I BN7, for a client.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain to find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners, turning items into hard cash. A butter churn, a slot machine and a set of print trays are among the finds in this edition.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.desc: When a ship sinks off the coast of Antarctica, investigators turn to the photos and videos taken by the surviving passengers to find out what went wrong.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews hear rumours of prime fishing near the ice pack, and a race begins to see who can reach the area first, but the long hours and adverse conditions gradually begin to take their toll on the men.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: The fleet scrambles for its last pans of gold as the ice season comes to an end, and while some captains meet their goals, others continue to struggle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard haggles hard at a museum of vintage farm equipment in Exmouth. Later, he is bowled over by an amazing collection of arts and crafts furniture.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie miners Justin and Daniel tread a dangerous path deep underground in an abandoned mine. Meanwhile, Kelly and Al search for a rare, valuable black opal.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer set the challenge to find the ultimate bug-out vehicle that would ceaselessly run, and decide on the Land Rover Series IIA.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien repurposes some old suitcases, while Henry Cole gives an old dresser some serious bling.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a warehouse in York, finds a dreamy black beetle at a specialist garage in Cambridgeshire, and an antiques dealer in Suffolk has a delightful model castle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead work on a 1964 Falcon Ranchero, one of the first utility vehicles, but this particular example is suffering under a coat of cheap black paint.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: David is a Volkswagen fanatic who wants a 1967 Beetle that can outmatch muscle cars. Plus, Robert wants a widened 1967 Corvette supercar.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How one of the world's most valuable metals, platinum, is mined. Plus, the production of manga comics and a look at how lemons are turned into an Italian after-dinner drinks.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The techniques used in surfing deadly waves, and how the Arizona Cardinals' NFL stadium is transformed into a monster-truck venue in just 48 hours.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of the search for missing five-year-old Melissa Brannen, who disappeared from a party. Investigators suspected a man present at the party..

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How the reconstruction of DNA by molecular biologists aided the Baton Rouge Police Department in catching a suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators determine how blood splatter evidence could prove that an obstetrician murdered his wife, despite his claims that he found her dead when he returned home.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 43-year-old Pennsylvania DJ Ervin Holton, who in November 2012 was shot dead on his friend's porch. With no witnesses, police turned to security cameras located opposite for clues.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of mother and daughter Angela and Ashley Hyke who went missing in July 2001, leaving candles burning and electric fans running in their home. Days later their bodies were found in shallow graves. Authorities quickly recognised that the key to identifying the murderer might lie in Angela's diary.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The authorities conclude their year-long search for gang leader James Springette when they manage to capture him in Medellin, Colombia.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The work of the Michigan Humane Society, a four-strong team of animal welfare officers that deals with more than 4,000 cases of cruelty and neglect every year.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team battle to save a puppy with broken ribs and internal bleeding, while Dr Baier attempts surgery he has never done before to treat a family's beloved rat.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Amanda finds a dress that tops the one she has already purchased at another shop, while consultant Keasha helps Brooke become a Kleinfeld bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: This Is My FiancÃ© and This Is His Wife!
programme.desc: The team is stunned when Jennifer brings her fiance - and his wife. Meanwhile, Amanda Barrasso seeks a dress fit for an ice queen.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown gets a terrible delivery when a kitten with shocking injuries turns up in a cardboard box, and Tim Faulkner struggles to remove a diamond python from a drain.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown visits Beijing and treats his first hamster, is stunned to have to tend to some pet snails, and has an unforgettable encounter with giant pandas.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Andy is pushed to his physical limits as he and Cynthia chase an injured dog through the dry canal system. Plus, the officers respond to a cock-fighting operation.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Mark seizes six abandoned dogs from a house where the owner has been evicted. A feral cat living in a police garage is treated for an injured paw.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The case of a man who staged his wife's suicide in a bid to cash in on her life insurance policy, but was caught out by modern forensic technology.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case in which an attractive, young woman moved to the US for a new opportunity, only to vanish without a trace a few weeks later. Previous kidnapping survivor Elizabeth Smart joined in the search.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old party animal Kortne Stouffer, who vanished from her Pennsylvania apartment in July 2012 after rowing with neighbours and friends.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: When arrested for historic sexual offences, TV weatherman Fred Talbot tried to hide the truth in police interviews. However, his repeated response of 'no comment' spoke volumes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride helping her fiance recover from an accident has had no time to think about her wedding dress - so supermodel Niki Taylor helps her to choose a gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori and Monte surprise super fan and bride-to-be Katie with an extra special bridal shopping experience at the salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer needs to lose 20 to 30 pounds to fit into a dress, while another bride tries to convince Lori to let her try on a gown that is beyond her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer faces a challenging fitting, and another bride disagrees with her mother about how her dress should look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Magan wants a gown with colour, but her unique choice has her family seeing red. Bride Monica is looking for a princess dress to honour her late mother's wishes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Hannah has already purchased two gowns, but unimpressed by either, she returns to the salon hoping to find a gown that represents her bridal fantasy.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three items from the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey. Bag-making specialist Neil Wraggs helps turn a pile of rustic hessian sacks into something more classy, designer Daniel Heath updates an old felted card table and Sarah's years as a chef come in handy with an unusual tip find.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan Hatfield and his sister Cherise try to negotiate a deal on a tuk-tuk, and cobbler Peter is looking for a quick cash deal on some designer shoes and an antique clock. Meanwhile, at Pickwick pawnbrokers in London, Nathan Finch secures deals on a classic silver Clipper caravan, some war memorabilia and several designer luxury bags.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Bedridden for four years, Penny knows her weight may kill her unless drastic actions are taken, and hopes to have a gastric bypass before it is too late.

programme.title: Inside the Mind of a Serial Killer
programme.desc: A psychological profile of Todd Kohlhepp, who was jailed in 1987 at the age of 15 for kidnap and rape and then murdered seven people in South Carolina after his release in 2001.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of Tanveer Iqbal. Spurned mistress Zatoon Bibi was jailed for life after being found guilty of killing her lover and putting his body in the boot of his car.

programme.title: Women Behind Bars with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part one of two. The veteran broadcaster follows life inside two prisons holding some of America's most notorious female criminals - Indiana Women's Prison and Rockville Correctional Facility in the same US state. Among the inmates he meets in the first edition are Sarah Pender, who went on the run while serving 110 years for double murder, before being captured four months later, and Martha Search, who is looking forward to getting to grips with modern technology when her 20-year sentence comes to an end.
